original: Andersson, Upps. — Mogiex. i Kalmar 95, fil. kand. 99, provår i Upps. 02. Res. t. Engl. 03, 04, 06, 08, 21 (m. statsstip.) samt 24, Tyskl. 05, 12 (m. statsstip.) 27 o. 30, Tyskl. o. Österr. m. OD 05, Engl. m. OD 07. Vik. adj. i Kalmar 00, lär. v. Upps. ensk. lärov. o. priv igymn. 00-05, v. Gbgs samsk. 05-07, adj. i modersm., tyska o. eng. v. Gbgs latin 07-41, vik. lektor där 27-41. Skolöverstyr. ombud v. realex. 18-41, led. av examensnd f. priv. i Gbg 14-41, v. ordf. i styr. f. Gbgs stadsteater. Skr.läroböcker i mod. språk samt tidn:- o. pedagog, art., över-sättn., huv:sakl. teaterpjäser. RVO.
translated: Andersson, born in Uppsala, worked as a teacher and lecturer, having obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in Kalmar in 1895 and having completed a probationary year in Uppsala in 1902. He traveled to England with government scholarships in 1903, 1904, 1906, 1908, 1921, and 1924, to Germany with government scholarships in 1905, 1912, 1927, and 1930, and to Austria and Germany with scholarships in 1905. and to England with a scholarship in 1907. He was a substitute teacher in Kalmar in 1900, a teacher at a private school in Uppsala from 1900 to 1905, a teacher at a school in Gothenburg from 1905 to 1907, and a teacher of mother tongue, German, and English at a school in Gothenburg from 1907 to 1941, serving as temporary head teacher there from 1927 to 1941. He also held positions as an educational official and member of the examination board. He was an author of language textbooks, articles on pedagogy, translations, and plays, and received the Royal Order of Vasa.
